captions.text:
Vsauce, I'm Jake and these are places in the
world that share my first name. You can use

the tool on Data Pointed to find your own
or use teleporter to jump to random spots

around the planet with Google Street View.
Once you're done teleporting, check out some
more things you can Do Online Now, Guys...DONGs.

Artist Daniel Boschung uses an industrial
robot to capture 900 million pixel portraits.

He takes 600 macro photographs and stitches
them together to form one complete image.

The result is a breathtaking ultra high resolution
photo that can be zoomed into for an incredible

level of detail. There are also a few amazing
ones of insects.

Instead of looking at dead insects, look at
dead colors. A chart that shows all the colors
with the hexadecimal number DEAD in them.

Now let me ask you a question, what if the
moon were only 1 pixel, a scale model of the

solar system where 1 pixel is equal to 2,159.1miles
or the diameter of the moon. Then create your

own solar system with Super Planet Crash.
The goal is to make a planetary system that

can remain stable for 500 years. It gets more
difficult and fun when you start adding in

bodies with a greater mass and more catastrophic.
After possibly mastering planet placement,

find some new ones with Planet Hunters. Using
data from NASA's Kepler Space Mission, the

site aims to have participants try and detect
possible planets by judging the change in
a star's brightness.

While exploring space, read up on what Einstein's
famous equation of e=mc^2 really means. Henry

from MinutePhysics put together a great interactive
mass-energy scale that shows how things like

the energy of a rifle bullet corresponds to
the mass of a human sperm.

Lets leave the vastness of space to check
out the urban jungle. Pick a location and

see what the streets would look like if they
were overrun with wilderness. If you find

it difficult to get around the trees and snakes,
take the mini metro. A subway layout game

where you draw train routes between stations
to try and get your growing population to
their destinations on time.

If all goes well as a transportation mogul,
come up with a slogan using The Advertising

Slogan Generator cus Mama's got the Magic
of Vsauce. Now that you control the metro

control some GIFs with GIF Control. You can
fast forward or rewind random ones to your

heart's content and upload your own. I could
watch this forever.
Obligatory 2048 mention.

And Holy Smokes Batman. com is a site dedicated
to bringing you the very best catchphrases
from 1960's Robin like my personal favorite...

Now take a moment to come on and sl.am. A
website that will change your life forever

but for something delicious let's check out
some porn...burger.me. 
Pornburger shows you some of the most ridiculicious

burger creations ever made like the cali-corn-ication
or the artery altering Slumberjack.

Then burn off some of those calories with
Epic Boss Fighter. Like a wave of Contra nostalgia,

Epic Boss Fighter gives you 10 levels of epic
battles. As you destroy more villains you
get cash to upgrade your abilities and armor.

Or be stealthy in Assasseed's Crin, a demake
of Assassin's Creed that thankfully still

includes hiding in hay. But instead of just
demaking games, dedesign the web. Where you

guess the website only by its wireframe. And
then move to the art world with Painting Parodies.

Pick which painting by what artist you think
each one is to win. After displaying your

art awareness, create your own with Bomomo,
a really fun drawing site. There are a multitude

of different shapes and brushes to choose
from so you can make something unique.

Keep creating with Patatap, a music tool.
The sounds you have at your disposal depend

on what background color you choose. Every
letter key between a to z is a different sound
so you can make things like this...

To fight off spam, there's a 10 minute email
address to use on sites that require an email

without giving your personal one. Since you're
not spending so much time deleting spam, relax

with A Soft Murmur, an ambient sound generator
that you can adjust to suit your needs. While

that's playing in the background see how many
words you can create out of these random assortments
of letters.

Before shutting down your computer for the
night, make sure to use Jurassic Park OS to
access the main program grid...
I can only express my frustrations with emojicons.com!

To go with these DONGs there is a new JAM,
a playlist of Just Awesome Music, over on

WEsauce so you can listen to some cool songs
while checking out some cool sites. And as
always, thanks for watching!
